PARAGRAPH.STRING: , officially the Republic of Paraguay (Spanish: República del Paraguay, pron. IPA [IPA: [re'puβlika del para'ɣwaj]], Guarani: Tetã Paraguái), is a landlocked country in South America.
lies on both banks of the Paraguay River, bordering Argentina to the south and southwest, Brazil to the east and northeast, and Bolivia to the northwest, and

is located in the very heart of South America. 'Paraguay' is derived from the Guaraní word 'Pararaguay', meaning, 'From a Great River'. The 'Great River' is the Paraná River, which produces the greatest amount of hydroelectric power in the world.
